content: back needle b the needle in the front is needle a but then you probably guessed that cut the wool leaving a long end thread a blunt needle with it and start grafting thread through the first stitch on a purlwise and the first stitch on b knitwise leave both stitches on their needles *thread through the first stitch on a knitwise and pull it off the needle thread through the next stitch on a purlwise and leave it on thread through the first stitch on b purlwise and pull it off the needle thread through the next stitch on b knitwise and leave it on repeat from * until all the stitches are grafted together darn in all the ends closing any holes at the base of the thumb and finger as you do so the left hand as you can see the two mittens are not identical the finger and thumb should lie on the palm side just to confuse you this photo shows the back of the mittens the left hand is worked exactly the same as the right until the left right end of the thumb the hand pick up and knit eight stitches from the base of the thumb then knit the stitches from the spare needle 46 sts knit 12 rounds or until your mitten reaches the bottom of the first finger of your hand knit the first 14 stitches cast on two more then put the rest of the stitches on a holder knit the 16 finger stitches once dividing them to work in the round now you can knit the finger as you did for the right hand the rest of the left mitten is worked the same as the right one it s very tricky taking a photo with one hand while holding a stick with the other abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches k knit p purl m1 make 1 by lifting the thread before the next stitch and knitting into the back of it k2tog knit two stitches together ssk slip slip knit slip two stitches knitwise or knitwise followed by purlwise one at a time insert tip of left needle into stitches from above put yarn round right needle and knit both stitches together © frankie brown 2016 my patterns are for personal use only and
